news.headline: Regional and Club Judge Qualified
news.section1: After being approached to judge the British National Setwork Championships, I was able to complete both my Club and Regional judging qualifications. The knowledge acrewed from these courses will both help me as a gymnast, but also open doors in the future once my career is over. Being able to stay apart of the sport as a judge for major competitions.
news.section2: After qualifying, I went on to judge the fairly major competition, one in which GB squad is chosen for the younger gymnasts. This experience allowed me to have a talk with a lot of the long-running judges, an excellent networking opportunity. Multiple judges had long running careers as civil engineers, software engineers, accountants and more! Who new the gymnastics judging space was a gold mine for STEM jobs!
news.section3: Overall, I thoroughly enjoyed the opportunity and it is now something I definitely look to pursue once my gymnastics career reaches its end!

news.headline: London Open
news.description: New pb on Pommel Horse and a Bronze medal.
news.section1: As this was the last competition of the season, all unmet goals of the year needed to be completed here, and it did not dissappoint!
news.section2: I finally hit my goal of achieveing over 70.0 all around score, even with 2 falls. I could not be happier with this finish to the season. Not only this, but I managed to secure my first national senior medal on the Pommel Horse! As the final piece, a good score was needed - I stepped up and performed! Absolutely ecstatic!

news.headline: UGC National Champion
news.description: A clean sweep winning Gold in the UGC league.
news.section1: Last month marked the final University Gymnastics Cup üèÜ competition of the year, where the title of National Champion was up for grabs. After a year of unwavering dedication to the sport, I‚Äôm incredibly proud to share that I‚Äôve been crowned the 2024‚Äì25 UGC National Champion in the FIG Men's category. On top of that, I was honoured to receive the Most Improved Gymnast of the Year award from the UGC committee ‚Äî a recognition that means a lot to me given the work I‚Äôve put in this season.
news.section2: This year has reignited my passion for gymnastics and feels like the true beginning of a new chapter in my journey. Having been involved in gymnastics for over a decade, I‚Äôm excited to see where this momentum takes me next.
